instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.message:
Got a machine here always shows the same fucked up screen.

What I have done:

Changed GPU twice (DC 1125) leaded solder (I reballed it) - My balls look good.
Changed new VRAM (of same type).
Tested with a known working chassis / screen.


My camera is fucking crap but......
The scree always looks like this:

[ATTACH alt="Click image for larger version  Name:	SAM_7536.JPG Views:	1 Size:	345.6 KB ID:	23851"]23851._xfImport[/ATTACH]
Is this a 2.2/2.3 board? Checked for damaged/missing resistors around VRAM/GPU. Inspected pads when GPU was off?

[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 23860"]Is this a 2.2/2.3 board? Checked for damaged/missing resistors around VRAM/GPU. Inspected pads when GPU was off?[/QUOTE]

2.2 board
Pads all good
No missing resistors

I fucked up and put 1GB on where 512MB shuold have been - Tried changing around R8611 /12 /13 but no firrerence. Tomorrow I'll put the original VRAM on there and change the straps back to original config.

I'll have to undo what I've done and post back.
